content: Hi - Is there any place in Practitioner or PractitionerRole resource where we can indicate practitioner is being Board Certified for a given Specialty. Looked into all detail in PlanNet IG but could not find any place. Do we need to define an extension for this? Please help.

Are you looking for something in addition to the Practitioner.qualification? The Da Vinci Plan net IG has several constraints and an extension on qualification.
image.png

Yaa but none of these are kind of boolean/indicator which can specify whether practitioner is being certified for given specialty -

https://www.certificationmatters.org/about/

Is that different than what is captured in the practitioner-qualification extension status?
https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-pdex-plan-net/StructureDefinition-practitioner-qualification.html
https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-pdex-plan-net/ValueSet-QualificationStatusVS.html

Hi @Corey Spears Thanks for your response.

It is different when a practitioner is specialized in something and active but not board certified. How to map this?

Binding to QualificationStatusVS is required , which means we can not add new value like 'Board Certified'. Thoughts?
Can I get any suggestion for this?

Could qualification.issuer provide a link to the board that issued the certification?
https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-pdex-plan-net/StructureDefinition-plannet-PractitionerRole-definitions.html#PractitionerRole.extension:qualification.extension:issuer

Thanks for input @Sean Mahoney . I checked and looks like issuer is not equal to certifier. And even we do not get the board name in our data. Its just an indicator which we receive from source which tells whether particular specialty is being certified or not .

Should we add another extension to specialty/qualification to indicate this?
Chetan, I will discuss with the larger group and come up with a solution.
Thanks @Sean Mahoney for taking this up
Hi @Sean Mahoney Any tentative date by when we can any input on this?
Chetan, I plan to bring it up on our weekly call so hopefully will have a response by end of week.

Chetan Jain said:

Hi Sean Mahoney Any tentative date by when we can any input on this?

Chetan, We discussed and Board Certified requires more then just Y/N. It requires who issued the certification. For that you can use the certificaiton.issuer.

Thanks @Sean Mahoney , that is for sure. I'm looking to accommodate a scenario when we don't get issuer name and still want to capture if particular specialty is being certified or not? This is I am finding hard to adjust. How about adding an extension to just capture this?
